trans-unit.source: Represents a section of the vector that can contain an integer number.
Use <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.CreateSection%2A> to define a new section.

A <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section> is a window into the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32> and is composed of the smallest number of consecutive bits that can contain the maximum value specified in <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.CreateSection%2A>.
For example, a section with a maximum value of 1 is composed of only one bit, whereas a section with a maximum value of 5 is composed of three bits.

You can create a <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section> with a maximum value of 1 to serve as a Boolean, thereby allowing you to store integers and Booleans in the same <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32>.

Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object is the same as the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object to compare with the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
`true` if the obj parameter is the same as the current object; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the specified object is the same as the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
This method overrides <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Two <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section> instances are considered equal if both sections are of the same length and are in the same location within a <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32>.
The object to compare with the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>.
`true` if the specified object is the same as the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
Serves as a hash function for the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>, suitable for hashing algorithms and data structures, such as a hash table.
This method overrides <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This method generates the same hash code for two objects that are equal according to the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section.Equals%2A> method.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>.
Gets a mask that isolates this section within the <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32"></xref>.
A mask that isolates this section within the <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32"></xref>.
Gets the offset of this section from the start of the <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32"></xref>.
The offset of this section from the start of the <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32"></xref>.
Determines whether two specified <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> objects are equal.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section.Equals%28System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section%2CSystem.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section%29?displayProperty=fullName>
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
`true` if the a and b parameters represent the same object, otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> objects have different values.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section.Compare%28System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section%2CSystem.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section%29?displayProperty=fullName>
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> object.
`true` if the a and b parameters represent different objects; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>.
Returns a string that represents the specified <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref> to represent.
A string that represents the specified <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32.Section"></xref>.
